trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an input file or a data stream that is supposed to conform to a certain file format specification is malformed.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class.
This constructor uses a default system message that describes the error, such as "An input file or a data stream does not conform to the expected file format specification."
This message takes into account the current system culture.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> value that represents the error message.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and includes the file name, such as "The file '`sourceUri`' does not conform to the expected file format specification."
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> value of the file that caused this error.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class and initializes it with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a specified error message and exception type.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance with the specified error message represented by `message`.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> value that represents the error message.
The value of the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property, which represents the cause of the current exception.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value and an exception type.

This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error and includes the file name, such as "The file '`sourceUri`' does not conform to the expected file format specification."
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> value of the file that caused this error.
The value of the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property, which represents the cause of the current exception.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value and a specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException> instance with the specified error message represented by `message`.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> value of the file that caused this error.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> value that represents the error message.

Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref> class with a source [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] value, a specified error message, and an exception type.
This constructor initializes the Message property of the new instance using the message parameter.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The <xref:System.IO.FileFormatException.SourceUri%2A> property is initialized using the `sourceUri` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> value of the file that caused this error.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> value that represents the error message.
The value of the <xref href="System.Exception.InnerException"></xref> property, which represents the cause of the current exception.
Sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object with the file name and additional exception information.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets the name of a file that caused the <xref href="System.IO.FileFormatException"></xref>.
If there was an error in obtaining the name the file that caused the exception, the return value is `null`, and SourceUri.<xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> returns an empty string.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that represents the name the file that caused the exception.
